name: Data Science for Technology, Innovation and Policy
base_name: Data Science for Technology, Innovation and Policy
long_desc: Students will learn how to use R to collect, organize, and analyze data in technology, innovation, and policyrelated domains. The focus will be on the practical issues faced when conducting data analyses, correctly implementing and interpreting statistical models, and summarizing results for clients and research purposes.

custom_fields.key_topics: Data exploration, visualization, programming in R, data wrangling, linear models, communication of statistical results, generalized linear model, panel data, technology and public policy applications of data science
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: At least one semester of statistics suggested.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Grades will be assessed based on homework and a final project.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Class will follow course notes and the textbook "R for Data Science" that is available on the web or for purchase.
